de.iftm.dcm4che.router.plugin
Class ExportImagePlugin

java.lang.Object
  de.iftm.dcm4che.router.plugin.DicomRouterPlugin
      de.iftm.dcm4che.router.plugin.ExportImagePlugin

public class ExportImagePlugin
extends DicomRouterPlugin

This plugins exports the given Dataset as a standard graphic image. It supports the properties which start with the key SaveFilesystemPlugin. For description of the subkeys (= properties) see the user manual.

annotation_type

int annotation_type
Type of image annotation.

directory

java.io.File directory
Directory to export the Dataset into.

font_color

java.awt.Color font_color
The color of the font for image annotation.

java.lang.String font_name
The name of the font for image annotation.

int font_size
The font size for image annotation.

image_format

java.lang.String image_format
ImageIO name of the graphic format.

image_size

int image_size
The size of the (square) image to export.

margin_size

int margin_size
The margin for image annotations in pixel.

filename

java.lang.String filename
Name of file to save. If the String starts with the character '$' the filename is set from the DICOM element named in the remaining part of the string.

name_postfix

java.lang.String name_postfix
A string to append after the name and before the file extension.

separate_patients

boolean separate_patients
If true, write files in the subdirectory "$PatientName_$PatientBirthDate//"

use_subdirectory

java.lang.String use_subdirectory
Write files in the subdirectory "[$PatientName_$PatientBirthDate/]//".

write_dir_tree

boolean write_dir_tree
If true: Construct the the file ID of the file to save from the following file ID components:
1. First letter of family name followed by first letter of given name followed by date of birth, 6 character. Example: HT570522
2. Study date, 6 character. Example: 043012
3. Modality, 2 character followed by study time, 4 character. Example: MR1531
4. Study ID. Example: 4711
5. Series number. Example: 3
6. Instance number. Example: 54
If false:
Construct the the name of the file to save from directory, filename name_postfix and the image_format as extension.
